oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic egg production in Finland - animal health, welfare and food safety issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Virtala, A.
Holma, U.
Hovi, M.
Hänninen, M.
Hyyrynen, T.
Rossow, L.
Kahiluoto, H.
Valros, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A total of 20 out of 23 commercial organic layer farms took part in the research. Data were collected through observation and by interviewing the producer, using a semi-structured interview guide. Laying hen welfare was estimated using environment-based and animal-based methods. Fresh faecal samples were collected from the floor for analysis of campylobacter and salmonella bacteria and for internal parasite identification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Sustaining Animal Health and Food Safety in Organic Farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Virtala, A.; Holma, U.; Hovi, M.; Hänninen, M.; Hyyrynen, T.; Rossow, L.; Kahiluoto, H. and Valros, A. (2005) Organic egg production in Finland - animal health, welfare and food safety issues. Paper at: Systems development: quality and safety of organic livestock products : proceedings of the 4th SAFO workshop, Frick, Switzerland, 17-19 March 2005.
